intro: Hymenolaena stellata, commonly known as star grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white, which bloom throughout the growing season. Hymenolaena stellata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for ornamental gardens and erosion control. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through rhizomes contribute to its adaptability in various environments.
